string-array.name: quiz_names
string-array.item: Strings, More Functions, and Multi-Dimensional Arrays

string-array.name: random_encounters
string-array.item: You just finished reading this amazing book called Coders, and you think that adding it to the syllabus will help students gain insight into the tech world, even if it is a little more work for them. What do you do?

The administration tells you that counting attendance by following along to lecture slides isn’t a good method, since students can simply follow along for their friends given their netID and password. It wants you to use i-clickers for attendance. What do you do?
MP0 is out and it\'s so hard the students need therapy! You’re not professionally trained for that, but you can help them in other ways. What do you do?
You see a lot of posts on the forum and on Reddit from beginner coders claiming that CS 125 is too hard, and that it isn’t beginner-friendly. What do you do?
MP1 is out, and cheating levels have increased drastically. What do you do?
There’s an epidemic! Well, not really, but it’s flu season and just about three fourths of the students are coughing in lecture. What do you do?
MP2 is out, and it’s harder than ever! Your students are stressed out, and your TAs and CAs are beginning to agree that it’s too hard, too. What do you do?
The mid-term grades are supposed to be uploaded on self-service, but the autograder is down! What do you do?
You notice that the class average is far lower than those of the previous years’, and you want to try to fix it. What do you do?
You noticed a fairly offensive image on the forum with your face photoshopped onto another image—let’s not go into detail. What do you do?
Your underpaid and overworked TAs and CAs are done. They go on strike against CS 125 until more are hired. What do you do?
Your students have reported bugs in online grading. What do you do?
Due to heavy scheduling, the administration keeps trying to postpone the CS 125 fair. They tell you now that the Fall 2019 fair must be held about a week before Spring break! What do you do?
It’s the end of the semester and your students are getting bored. Most of them spend lectures watching Netflix. What do you do?
Your students are losing interest in lectures, and you want to keep their attention. You’re thinking about how to fix this when your cat, Xyz, jumps onto your laptop. What do you do?
It’s the end of the semester and your students are getting bored. Most of them spend lectures watching Netflix. What do you do?

string-array.name: positiveEncounter
string-array.item: Vehemently disagree and continue with your method
Reduce the difficulty of the course a little.
Turn a blind eye; the MP is too hard, anyway
Tell the students to go home and rest
Work on it devotedly, along with all your Course Developers and TAs.
Add an extra credit opportunity in MP3
Agree to hire more TAs and paid CAs
Accept the change in date and inform your students of the delay
Get the administration to block Netflix on IllinoisNet

string-array.name: negativeEncounter
string-array.item: Don’t add Coders to the syllabus
Agree to their terms and ask your students to bring i-clickers
Tell the students that they’re supposed to be overwhelmed and do nothing else
Increase the difficulty instead to teach them a little discipline
Create a complex plagiarism checker to counter the evil cheaters
Ignore it and continue with the lecture
Delay the mid-term grades a little and work on fixing it slowly
Do nothing, remind your students that office hours exist
Drown them in legal notices until they’re forced to go back to work
Aggressively pursue them until you get the date you’d initially asked for
Do not bring Xyz to lecture

string-array.name: encounterForumFirstNames
string-array.item: Student who bombed 4 quizzes in a row

string-array.name: encounterForumFirst
string-array.item: Nooooo I hate Coders because I think I\'m a superior STEM student who should not READ and should only do STEM stuff
Thank you, Geoff, for being kind enough to understand that i-clickers are an absolute waste of money. You’re my hero
Oh man the extra office hours saved my life, I can finally go to bed

I’m glad that Geoff hasn’t acknowledged the cheating… the course is really hard on beginners y\'know. btw someone send me the MP code pls because I think everyone should do my work for me since I can’t really think for myself and don’t even want to try
Thanks a lot for letting us go home Geoff, I’m hoping for a speedy recovery and this really helps!
Oh my god this really saved my grade. I think I might actually get a solid B now, if I work hard enough!
There weren’t enough people in office hours today and I couldn’t submit my MP checkpoint on time because nobody was there to help me
Oh man I really needed this extra credit to fix my GPA, this is a lifesaver
Man Geoff is such a spoilsport, that was a funny meme. This is a violation of my freedom of speech!
Yaaaay more TAs! Now maybe I’ll actually get some attention in office hours
Honestly this was the best lecture in weeks, Ben made everything better just by existing
LOL no way am I going to the project fair if it’s in Spring! I only signed up for the extra credit
Ohmigosh an adorable cat in lecture is the best thing EVER, this is going on my snap

string-array.name: encounterForumSecondNames
string-array.item: Student who bombed 4 quizzes in a row

string-array.name: encounterForumSecond
string-array.item: I\'m so glad there isn\'t required reading for this course, this reinforces my faux feeling of superiority over other majors in other courses
Why would you agree to this Geoff, I hate i-clickers they cost MONEY. f*** capitalism
I just had ANOTHER mental breakdown in office hours. I can’t take this anymore, why wouldn’t you just listen to us :’(“
Why do bad things happen to good people? I do all my work by myself why did the plagiarism checker think I cheated? This is really going to mess up my grade
Well, I made everybody come to class and now I’m sick too. Class is cancelled, guys. Peace out.
I cry myself to sleep every night because of the MP… I need therapy
Lol who cares about mid-term grades, they don’t affect my GPA
Office hours don’t help when TAs spend less than 4 minutes with you. I WANT EXTRA CREDIT
\@Challen Why would you leave that up, this is a university course forum it’s completely inappropriate and it’s awful, I don’t want to look at that!!!!
I can’t believe you’d do that to your loyal staff, Geoff. I mean, this is a new low. I hate you now
GET. RID. OF. THE. DAMN. BUGS.
Yaaaaay the fair gives us extra credit!! Now I definitely want to go
Nothing happens in lecture anymore, I wish Geoff did something cool

string-array.name: encounterMailFirst
string-array.item: Thank you for the requested pictures of your dog. It really brightened up our day. Now, about CS 125, you added something unique to the coursework and we are pleased. Computer Science at Illinois has been extremely prestigious, but I think your plan of introducing students to the tech world from the very beginning, through an interesting piece of literature, is an interesting approach which may work out for the better.

Thank you for considering our request to use i-clickers as a means of attendance in your class. Although we are disappointed that you still won’t agree to use them despite constant pursuance of the matter, we understand that some people just don’t listen. You can keep using your little lecture slide toy you created to amuse yourself and your students, but the bottom line is: if things don’t cost students, we probably don’t want them.

One of our CAs collapsed during office hours because he ran around so much trying to help everybody. None of us feel fulfilled enough because we can never completely help students since we’re not allowed to spend more than a few minutes with a student. We’re tired and all we want is a nap but we’re not getting any and now you go ahead and add extra office hours. We love you Geoff and we love the students, but why? TELL ME WHY?

Our competitor, Purdon’t, has weed-out introductory courses in Computer Science. We accepted your terms when you said you didn’t want to make this course weed-out, but this is just ridiculous. Why do you want to teach your students kindergarten level courses in CS? Of course, I have no idea how to educate a student and how hard an intro-level CS course should be like, but you should really increase the difficulty tenfold.

Rumours that you were aware of ongoing cheating in your course, but chose to turn a blind eye among it, have been flying around. I hope you realise that if these claims turn out to be true, you could be removed from your position at the university. Please remember our code of conduct and strictly adhere to it.

Out of the 500+ people enrolled in CS 125, there was a grand total of 10 people in lecture this week. Why, Geoff, why? Why would you tell them to go home? Do you not want your students to suffer like everybody else does? Come on, man.

We’re happy that you’re providing an MP Drop for CS 125. No, we really are! We wanted you to increase the course difficulty earlier, but we realised that the students are becoming increasingly depressed now. We cannot be expected to spend even more money on mental health resources than we already are— our lone psychiatrist can’t handle all of them, so we’re happy if you’re letting your students be happy!

We understand that there were a few major bugs in your autograder. We’re overjoyed that you fixed them in time and were able to put up the mid-term grades. This allows us to go over our grading processes smoothly. Good Geob, Geoff!

The staff is tired and worn out. The extra credit portion is much harder than the rest of the MP, and students just keep piling in. We can’t help them all. It’s day 31 and we’re running out of food and water supplies. Stop this madness, Geoff.

We noticed you finally took down that terrible image from the forum. Such derogatory content is completely inappropriate, not just for academic purposes. The University of Illinois will never condone such images, and the student who posted it will be dealt with appropriately.

Your decision to hire more staff members following the protests of the course staff last week is a disappointing one. The university cannot afford to do redirect funds, especially for an introductory course, thus doing so will reflect badly on your profile.

We have been made aware that you were not present at the lecture for the last week for CS125, while your Head CA, Ben Nordick, took your place. This is not in accordance with our policies since we weren’t notified prior to this substitution. We are not happy with the situation, just do your job Geoff.

Thank you for rescheduling the Project Fair. Thank you for understanding that the students’ apps are not going anywhere. In its stead, we will be able to hold a TED conference at the university on the topic “Consequences of actions in controlled environments”. You are free to attend with no entry fee.

This is in reference to you having your pet, “Xyz”, at lecture last week. We have received complaints from students stating they have serious allergies that were caused by the presence of your cat. They have agreed not to take legal action. We are disappointed, and we hope that you will abstain from carrying personal pets to your classes.

string-array.name: encounterMailSecond
string-array.item: Thank you for the requested pictures of your dog. It really brightened up our day. Now, about CS 125, we noticed that you’re still the professor. Wonderful. It would’ve been great if you had added something new to the course this semester, but now I guess it’s just another dry semester of coding and nothing unique. Ah well.

Thank you for accepting our requests and adding i-clickers to CS125. We love that students have to spend more money than they already are on their education, and even though we’re one of the top 5 universities for CS, we hate embracing new, useful technology that could save students’ money! You’re the best, dude.

One of our CAs collapsed during office hours because he ran around so much trying to help everybody. None of us feel fulfilled enough because we can never completely help students since we’re not allowed to spend more than a few minutes with a student. Thanks a lot for not agreeing to extra office hours, because I don’t think we could’ve survived that. Of course, the students are not going to be happy about this, but at least we’ll survive now.

You finally realised that you need to make the course harder. We love it. We’d go so far as to use an emoji in our email: :’) \nCS 125 finally feels like a real college course and we maintain our reputation for being one of the best universities for CS in the world. Of course, I have no idea how to educate a student and how hard an intro-level CS course should be like, but it should definitely make students cry themselves to sleep.

CONGRATULATIONS! You just caught a bunch of evil cheaters. Good job, Geoff! Cheating is bad and always will be, and we’re going to use your plagiarism checker in all courses offered by the university! We’re aware of the few honest students being caught, but we’ll just have them file recheck requests and make them do more work due to our mistakes. We love doing that!

We are positively mortified that you, a professor at our university, had to cancel Monday’s lecture. How could you let yourself get sick? Why didn’t you just tell your sick students to go home? This is not how we expected a professor of your esteem to act.

Your students are increasingly becoming stressed out due to the pressures of CS 125, especially the MP. We had initially wanted the course to be more difficult, but we don’t have the mental health resources to help all your students. Our lone psychiatrist cannot help them all, and we’re never going to spend another dime on something the students actually need, so we can’t have you making them all sad and such.

We understand that there were a few major bugs in your autograder. However, we’re extremely disappointed that you didn’t try to fix them as soon as possible and put up the mid-term grades. Delaying the mid-term grades is an atrocious act against the administration, and we will not stand for this.

The staff is tired and worn out from helping students. Thank you for not adding the extra credit portion. We understand that students need to increase their grades, but we honestly could not have been able to survive much longer if a longer, harder extra credit portion was added. We are grateful.

We noticed that you decided to leave a horribly derogatory meme on the CS 125 forum, up. You have made a severe and continuous lapse in your judgement. This kind of behaviour will not be tolerated, with no exceptions.

We have finished processing the legal charges you pressed against the Course Assistants and Teaching Assistants for CS125. The course staff should be back to work now, unless they want to lose their positions. As you did not negotiate with the protesters, we believe you made the correct decision.

It has come to our attention that the CS125 course website is riddled with bugs. This is completely unacceptable, as a CS professor should lead by example, especially in an introductory course. We hope that you are able to correct the issues soon.

We are disappointed you could not host the Project Fair at another time. As a direct consequence of your decision, the university lost a considerable amount of exposure and experience. This will not bode well for your future as a university employee.

We have been receiving an increasing number of complaints regarding the quality of your course deteriorating over the course of the semester, with more and more students saying that it is boring. We hope that this is a mere coincidence, and you will try to make lectures more enjoyable.

resources.string: Welcome to the course! This is where you will receive periodic emails from us, letting you know what you are doing right and what you are doing wrong. As you are the professor, your decisions influence everyone involved with the course, from the students to the CAs and TAs to the administration. Make your decisions wisely!
The students have been slogging on the homework daily. They really need a break.
I think it’s okay to give homework that’s a little challenging. Nothing too difficult, though… But I wouldn’t know, I’m just code.
The students seem ready to take on some real challenges in homework!
Maybe you should give an easy quiz this time. The students are really stressing over their grades.
The students would like their quizzes to be just right: not too hard, and not too easy.
The students aren’t taking the quizzes seriously enough. Maybe you should remind them that they need to properly study for this course.
The MP always ends up overwhelming a student. You should probably make this checkpoint easy.
A nice, average MP would hopefully not stress out a student but also actually make them learn useful information.
The students seem ready to take on a challenging MP!
Maybe you should make this midterm easy. The students are really stressing over it.
You should consider making the midterm difficulty just right: not too hard, not too easy.
Give the students a challenge this time round! Even if they mess up, at least the midterm is only worth 2% of their grade.
The homework today was so easy lol this class is a joke
The homework today is too hard, I wanna die aaaaaa
The homework today was perfect! It was so satisfying to see I got a 100% for once
The quiz was too easy like WTF Geoff?!?!?!!?!?!!
The quiz was so hard oh my god I got like a 50%
The quiz was amazing; I did well and it felt perfect!
The midterm was too easy :/ I wish I’d just prof’d out of this course
The midterm was really hard. I cried myself to sleep because of it :(
The midterm was great; I did really well!
The MP is too easy… I dunno if I’m even learning anything in this course
THE MP IS TOO HARD ONLY JESUS CAN SAVE ME
The MP was surprisingly decent this time round. Thank goodness, my grade won’t die.
This is the first quiz of the course! You probably should go easy on the students to get them used to quizzes
These are the first homework problems so you should probably make it easy :)
I-clickers are the WORST, I would never make my students pay more than they already are for college!
You have submitted the quiz difficulty for this week!
You have submitted the MP difficulty for this week!
You have submitted the homework difficulty for this week!
You have submitted the midterm difficulty for this week!
There are no quizzes this week. Check back later!
There is no MP this week. Check back later!
There are no midterms this week. Check back later!
There are no posts on the forum right now!
This game was created by Ishita Rao and Kanav Bhatnagar as their final project for CS 125. They cool. Pls give them an A+, they’ll give you a singular cookie.

Music we’re using: 
"8 Bit Win!" By HeatleyBros 
Nyan Cat [original] by Daniwell-P/Momone Momo UTAU


Cat Icon: 
Icons made by Smashicons 
www.flaticon.com
Thank you for your impeccable decision making. We hope you will continue to have the university\'s interests in mind when making influential choices related to the course.

If you continue making decisions that are against the university\'s interests, there may be serious ramifications related to your position as the professor for CS125 in the future. We hope that you will be more cautious of the consequences of your actions in the future.
▼・ᴥ・▼\nWho doesn\'t love dogs? If you bring Chuchu to lecture it will surely brighten up all of your students\' days.

You call upon Jesus himself, the Messiah! With his big brain energy, he influences both the students and the university to help your reputation. How he does so is a mystery that us mere mortals can only hope to comprehend.

If you really need help THAT bad, why not contact the man, the myth, the legend! As an experienced professor, he can influence the university\'s opinion of you for the better. He will give a 2 hour lecture before doing so, though.

Welcome, Geoff! You’re back for the Fall 2019 semester to teach CS 125. Your students last Spring were moderately happy with your work, congrats! However, that means that your new batch of students and the university have high expectations from you to do a great job, yet again. \n\nLet\'s get started! Choose the number of weeks in the semester:
This is your handy help page, informing you of the various tools that’ll aid you in teaching your class. Tap a subheading to get more info on it.

The semester is divided into 5/10/15 weeks depending on what you chose. You’ll be able to go to the next week only after planning the difficulties for homework, quiz (if any), midterm (if any), and MP checkpoint (if any). Check the forum and university email every week for helpful tips!


You have two satisfaction bars: student satisfaction, and university satisfaction (including administration, you, and anybody who is paid to run CS 125). Your actions in the game will affect these bars. If, at any point, either of the bars hit zero, you automatically lose the game.


Every week, you’ll face a random encounter, and your actions will affect student and university satisfaction. Choose wisely.


You have three bonuses: 
Chuchu the dog/Xyz the cat (either one): boosts student satisfaction 
The real Geoff Challen: boosts university satisfaction 
Java Chad Ben Nordick: boosts both student and university satisfaction by a little bit 
You can use each bonus only once per game.
This is where you’ll learn what your students feel about the course so far. It can be helpful to know where you’re going wrong, or what you’re doing correctly.

This is where you’ll periodically get email from the university, letting you know if they’re happy with what you’ve been doing. This, too, can be useful in pinpointing your errors to help you make the next week better.

Here, you’ll set the difficulty of each aspect of the course for the following week, from 0 to 9 (0 is the easiest, 9 is the hardest). There’ll also be advice that should help you decide the difficulty. A few things to note: 
1. 	Midterms are available in weeks 4, 9, and 14. 
 Quizzes are not available during these weeks. 
2. 	MPs start from week 2, and won’t be available in week 	 14.

string-array.name: endgame_student_0
string-array.item: Wow, you handled this really badly. Everybody: your students, staff, and the administration, hate you. You were forced to resign, and end up hanging yourself in a janitor’s closet at Siebel.
Oh no! Your students absolutely despise you, and they all stopped coming to lecture or doing anything related to CS 125. Depressed, you resigned as professor and never touched a computer again.

string-array.name: endgame_student_40
string-array.item: The university is sick of your shenanigans. You are forced to resign immediately, and you end up leaving the country. You never teach again.

Neither your students nor the administration was happy with your work this semester. You are no longer allowed to hold a teaching position at UIUC. You decide to leave and try your hand at teaching at a different university.

The administration and staff consider your work to be average, but the students are really disappointed. A lot of them change their major thanks to you, and nobody wants to be a CA next semester. You do not get more resources from the administration, but that’s okay, since you probably won’t have many students to teach anymore.

While the administration and your staff are moderately happy with your work, your students seriously dislike you. This shows in the ICES forms, and nobody wants to be a CA for CS 125 next semester. After a little grovelling, the university is willing to provide more resources to you, to keep the class running.

The ICES forms are filled with intense criticism of your teaching methods. You get almost no CAs for the next semester, and course registration drops significantly. The university is more than willing to provide more resources since they’re extremely happy with your work, but was it really worth it?

The administration and your staff absolutely adore you! You’re offered multiple promotions into administrative positions, and you take them immediately. This is just as well, because your students seriously dislike you, and completely trashed you on the ICES forms. You’re getting paid more, but was it really worth it?

string-array.name: endgame_student_60
string-array.item: The university is sick of your shenanigans. You are forced to resign immediately, and you end up leaving the country. You never teach again.
Your students considered your teaching to be average, but the university was not very pleased with your work. You have now been assigned to take CS 100.

Everybody: your students, your staff, and the administration, considers your work to be average. It was a dry semester with nothing amazing. The expectations of you have lowered, but nothing else has changed.
Expectations from your staff and the administration haven’t changed, but your students consider your work to be average. Buck up, Geoff!

Your students find you to be average, but you did a great job satisfying the university! You’re getting plenty more resources, and are generally seen as a good professor by them. Maybe you should try again to make your students happier, however.
Your students find you to be average, the university is absolutely in love with you. You’ve been approved for a lot more resources next semester, to try to make your students happier.

string-array.name: endgame_student_80
string-array.item: The university is sick of your shenanigans. You are forced to resign immediately, and you end up leaving the country. You never teach again.
Your students are moderately happy with your work, but you failed at pleasing the administration. You were placed on probation. Do better.
Expectations from your students haven’t changed, but the administration and your staff consider your work to be average. Buck up, Geoff!

Everybody: your students, your staff, and the administration, is moderately happy with your work. The expectations from you haven’t changed much, and nothing much happened. Nothing much WILL happen, either.

Expectations from your students haven’t changed, but you did a great job satisfying the administration and your staff. You are generally seen as a good professor, and did a better job than you did last semester. Congrats!

The expectations from your students haven’t changed much, but the administration and your staff absolutely adore you. They’re inviting you to your weddings and are making Geoff-themed cakes, just for you. Good Geob!

string-array.name: endgame_student_99
string-array.item: The university is sick of your shenanigans. You are forced to resign immediately, and you end up leaving the country. You never teach again.

Your students are extremely happy with your teaching and grading processes, congrats! They even send you cards on your birthday. However, you failed at pleasing the administration and your staff; you end up facing a lot of cuts for CS 125.

Your students are extremely happy with your teaching and grading processes, congrats! They even send you cards on your birthday. The administration and your staff consider your work to be average. You did an okay job. That’s not too bad, but you could do better.

Your students are extremely happy with your teaching and grading processes, congrats! They even send you cards on your birthday. Expectations from the administration and your staff haven’t changed much. You did a better job than you did last semester. Good for you, Geoff!

Whoa, you’re insanely good at professoring, Mr. Professor. You were nominated for the World’s Best Geoff award, and most people agree that you should win. Along with this award, you win a personal dictionary where all Js are replaced by Gs, and all Es are replaced by ‘Eo’s. Congrats!

string-array.name: endgame_student_100
string-array.item: The university is sick of your shenanigans. You are forced to resign immediately, and you end up leaving the country. You never teach again.

The university is displeased with your work, and the course faced a lot of cuts. Many of your TAs and Course Developers are trying to look for different jobs. However, your students are perfectly satisfied with your work, congrats! Years later, when you’re old and worn, you still receive wedding invitations from your students.

The administration and your staff consider your work to be average. However, your students are perfectly satisfied with your work, congrats! Years later, when you’re old and worn, you still receive wedding invitations from your students.

The administration and your staff are moderately happy with your work. While a few of your TAs are still going to leave, most of them are happy to stay on! Your students are perfectly satisfied with your work, congrats! Years later, when you’re old and worn, you still receive wedding invitations from your students.

Whoa, you’re insanely good at professoring, Mr. Professor. You were nominated for the World’s Best Geoff award, and most people agree that you should win. Along with this award, you win a personal dictionary where all Js are replaced by Gs, and all Es are replaced by ‘Eo’s. Congrats!

You beautiful professor, you. You managed to keep your students, staff, and the administration perfectly happy. You miraculous professor. You genius. You’re being nominated for multiple awards for best professor at the U of I. I don’t know how you did it, but goddamn. Contact the makers of this game for a cookie.
